results.title: Question of prejudice
results.brief_description: A study of the racist atitudes of some Australians toward migrant Australians, highligting the ‘wog’ syndrome. Investigtes the discrimination shown in the workforce towards groups such as the Lebanese, and its human effects such as the loss of self-esteem. Includes the views of Robert Cameron (White Australia Movement) and children.

results.title: Acoustic behaviour of the grey kangaroo
results.creator_credit: Ross Christopher and Australian National University
results.brief_description: Looks at the work done at the Acoustic Laboratory of the research School of Biological Sciences at the Australian National University on senses in kangaroos. Shows the environment of the kangaroo and how its hearing is used in cooperation with its eyes for scanning.

results.title: Keeping wool in shape
results.brief_description: Examines Australian advances in wool science from new methods of washing and spinning raw wool to technologically advanced techniques for dyeing, shrinkproofing and printing wool textiles. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Children of the unfaithful: the friends of my friends
results.creator_credit: Daniel Bertolino and Via le Monde
results.brief_description: Looks at the life of a young shepherd boy in a village on the border of Afghanistan and Pakistan. Depicts the care of sheep and also shows growing and milling of wheat, husking of corn, and the spinning of wool for clothing. Emphasises the role played by each member of the village in meeting the needs of the community. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Reproduction in organisms
results.brief_description: Conveys an impression of the scope of reproduction in nature, using turtles, the garden snail, selected insects and spiders as examples. Considers features of sexual reproduction by studying rock oysters, a green marine alga, leopard slugs and a flowering plant. Illustrates two examples of asexual reproduction: zoospore production by a filamentous alga and the parthenogenetic production of offspring by aphids during summer. Relevant to Year 11 Biology.

results.title: Beyond reasonable doubt: the Ronald Ryan case
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Murray Travis and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: A dramatised recreation of the trial of Ronald Ryan for the murder of a Pentridge prison officer with events leading up to the trial and a re-examination of the evidence. Ronald Ryan was the last man hanged in Australia in 1967. He was sentenced to death for allegedly shooting a warder while escaping from Pentridge Prison in the company of fellow prisoner, Peter Walker. Presenter Gordon Hawkins re-examines the scenario put forward by the prosecution at Ryan’s trial, using animated re-enactments and discussion of forensic evidence offered at the trial. He investigates the possibility that Ryan’s conviction was made without him being given the benefit of the doubt, and discusses the inequities and problems the trial system itself can create for the accused person at trial. Starring Bill Hunter as Ronald Ryan.

results.title: The Leith Ratten case
results.creator_credit: Tristram Miall, Murray Travers and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: A dramatised recreation of the trial and conviction of Leith Ratten for the murder of his wife in Shepparton in 1970. Examines the events preceeding the trial and reexamines the evidence. Stars Danny Adcock and Julie Dawson.
